snippet: The appointment of an ambassador to Somalia for the first time in two decades signaled London’s intention to help make a push to address the country’s long-running conflict.
abstract: Britain sends Foreign Secretary William Hague to Mogadishu and appoints an ambassador to Somalia for the first time in two decades, signaling London’s intention to help make a push to address the country’s long-running conflict.
lead_paragraph: The appointment of an ambassador to Somalia for the first time in two decades signaled London’s intention to help make a push to address the country’s long-running conflict.
